Intervention: Participants received 200 mg of pembrolizumab IV every three months for 35 doses (up to approximately 2 years).

Participants received capecitabine, eribulin, gemcitabine or vinorelbine as chemotherapy to a single agent chosen by the attending physician (Medical Choice Treatment, CPT) in accordance with local regulations and guidelines.
Eligibility: Level IV/M1 mTNCC confirmed at central level
New tumour biopsy obtained from the metastatic site
Central determination of the tumour state of ligand 1 (PD-L1) of programmed cell death
Has received one or two previous systemic treatments for metastatic breast cancer and documented the progression of the disease during or after the most recent treatment
Previously treated with anthracycline and/or a taxane in the neoadjuvant/adjuvant or metastatic setting
The rate of return of the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) of 0 or 1 within 10 days prior to the start of the study
Participation in another clinical trial within 4 weeks
A monoclonal antibody (mAb) for direct antineoplastic treatment within 4 weeks
- Chemotherapy, targeted treatment with small molecules, or radiation therapy within at least 2 weeks
• An active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment in the last two years
● Diagnosis of systemic immunodeficiency or steroid therapy or other immunosuppressive treatment within 7 days
• Known additional malignancy that has required treatment or progressed over the last 5 years
• Known active brain metastases and/or carcinoma meningitis

Previous treatment with a cell death anti-programming (PD)-1, an anti-PD-ligand-1 (anti-PD-L1), an anti-PD-L2 or an agent directed to another T cell receptor co-inhibitor (e.g., cytotoxic T-lymphocyte protein 4 [CTLA-4], OX-40, CD137) or who has previously been involved in clinical studies on pembolizumab (MK-3475)
Results: Overall survival in participants with scheduled cell death Ligand 1 (PD-L1) with combined positive score (SCP) 10
Overall survival (OS) was defined as the time between randomization and death for any cause.
Timeline: Up to approximately 36 months (up to the final analysis database deadline of April 11, 2019)
Description of the arm/group: Participants received pembrolizumab 200 mg IV every three months for up to 35 doses (up to approximately 2 years).

Description of the arm/group: Participants received capecitabine, eribulin, gemcitabine or vinorelbine as single agent chemotherapy chosen by the attending physician (Medical Choice Treatment, CPT) in accordance with local regulations and guidelines.
